meta.title: Get All Channels - Channels - Channels - Management APIs - API Reference
meta.description:
Returns a list of Channels.

Will always return the default BigCommerce storefront with an ID of 1. This storefront is created by default when you provi...

blocks.data:
Returns a list of *Channels*.

Will always return the default BigCommerce storefront with an ID of `1`. This storefront is created by default when you provision a BigCommerce store.

### OAuth Scopes
|  **UI Name** | **Permission** | **Parameter** |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  Channel Listings | modify | `store_channel_listings` |
|  Channel Listings | read-only | `store_channel_listings_read_only` |
|  Channel Settings | modify | `store_channel_settings` |
|  Channel Settings | read-only | `store_channel_settings_read_only` |
|  Sites & Routes | modify | `store_sites` |
|  Sites & Routes | read-only | `store_sites_read_only` |

### Headers

|Header|Parameter|Description|
|-|-|-|
|`X-Auth-Token`|`access_token `|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|

### Example

```http
GET /stores/{$$.env.store_hash}/v3/catalog/summary
host: api.bigcommerce.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-Auth-Token: {access_token}
```


* For more information on Authenticating BigCommerce APIs, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication).
* **Name**: X-Auth-Token
* **Location**: header

include.description: Channels subresources that can be included in the response.

available.description: Filter items based on whether the channel is currently available for integration. Setting this query parameter to `true` will return channels with the status of `prelaunch`, `active` , `inactive`, and `connected`. Setting this query parameter to `false` will return channels with the status of `disconnected`, `archived`, `deleted`, and `terminated`.

status:in.description: Filter items by a comma-separated list of statuses.

type:in.description: Filter items by a comma-separated list of types.

platform:in.description: Filter items by a comma-separated list of platforms. For a list of supported platforms, see [Platform](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-reference/store-management/channels#platform).

date_created.description: Filter items by date_created. For example, `date_created=2019-09-04T00:00:00`, `date_created=2019-09-04`, or `date_created=1567573200`

date_created:min.description: Filter items by minimum date_created. For example, `date_created:min=2019-09-04T00:00:00`, `date_created:min=2019-09-04`, or `date_created:min=1567573200`

date_created:max.description: Filter items by maximum date_created. For example, `date_created:max=2019-09-04T00:00:00`, `date_created:max=2019-09-04`, or `date_created:max=1567573200`

date_modified.description: Filter items by date_modified. For example, `date_modified=2019-09-04T00:00:00`, `date_modified=2019-09-04`, or `date_modified=1567573200`

date_modified:min.description: Filter items by minimum date_modified. For example, `date_modified:min=2019-09-04T00:00:00`, `date_modified:min=2019-09-04`, or `date_modified:min=1567573200`

date_modified:max.description: Filter items by maximum date_modified. For example, `date_modified:max=2019-09-04T00:00:00`, `date_modified:max=2019-09-04`, or `date_modified:max=1567573200`

limit.description: Controls the number of items per page for paginated responses.

page.description: Specifies the page number for a paginated response.

app.description: A [channel app](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/channels/overview#channel-apps) config object for optionally configuring the channel's user interface in the control panel.

id.description: The unique `id` given to an app registered in [DevTools](https://devtools.bigcommerce.com/); used to create links to the app in channel manager. `app.id` is optional; however, if you're building an app that creates or manages a channel, we recommend including it to ensure the user interface in the control panel works properly. Select partners who are promoted in the Channel Manager must build an app, and include the app ID in the create channel request. [Learn how to find an App''s ID](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/apps/tutorials/id).

sections.description: If set, when the app is loaded within the control panel, the navigation `sections` will be directly embedded in the control panel navigation.

title.description: The title of the navigation section.

query_path.description: The value that will be passed to the app's iFrame in the URL and will allow the app to display the appropriate section within the app iFrame in the control panel.

external_id.description: Associated ID within a system / platform outside of BC.

is_listable_from_ui.description: Indicates if a channel can create listings from the BigCommerce UI. Default value for this field is based on the channel type and platform combination if not specified on create.

is_visible.description: Indicates if a channel is visible within the BigCommerce merchant admin UI (control panel). If `false`, the channel will not show in Channel Manager nor in any channels dropdown throughout the UI. Default value for this field is `true` if not specified on create.

is_enabled.description: This field was originally used to turn on/off a channel but is deprecated. `status` should be used in place of `is_enabled`. Channel with `status` of `prelaunch`, `active`, or `connected` will have `is_enabled` set to `true`. Channel with `status` of `inactive`, `disconnected`, `archived`, `deleted`, or `terminated` will have `is_enabled` set to `false`.

status.description: The status of the channel; channel `type`, `platform`, and `status` must be a [valid combination](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-reference/store-management/channels#status). `terminated` is not valid for `PUT` or `POST` requests. `deleted` is not valid for `POST` requests.

name.description: Name of the channel as it will appear to merchants in the control panel.

type.description: The type of channel; channel `platform` and `type` must be a [valid combination](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-reference/store-management/channels#platform).

platform.description: The name of the platform for the channel; channel `platform` and `type` must be a [valid combination](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-reference/store-management/channels#platform).

date_created.description: Date on which the channel was first created.

date_modified.description: Date on which the channel was most recently changed.

meta.description: Data about the response, including pagination.

per_page.description: The maximum number of items per page.

total.description: Total number of items in the result set.

count.description: Total number of items in the collection response.

total_pages.description: The total number of pages in the collection.

links.description: Pagination links for the previous, current, or next parts of the whole collection.

previous.description: Link to the previous page returned in the response.

current.description: Link to the current page returned in the response.

next.description: Link to the next page returned in the response.

blocks.data: Invalid value is provided to the query parameter(s).

title.description: The error title describing the particular error.

type.description: Link to a list of BigCommerce API status codes.
